text: National Council elections were held in Bhutan on 20 April 2018.Third Parliamentary Elections 2018: National Council Election Commission of Bhutan ==Electoral system== Twenty of the 25 members of the National Council are elected from single-member constituencies using first-past-the-post voting.Electoral system IPU ==Results== {| class=wikitable style=text- align:right !Dzongkhag !Candidate !Votes !% !Notes |- |align=left rowspan=2|Bumthang||align=left|Nima||3,513||59.22||align=left|Re-elected |- |align=left|Kencho Tshering||2,419||40.78|| |- |align=left rowspan=6|Chukha||align=left|Sangay Dorji||5,079||33.71||align=left|Elected |- |align=left|Hem Kumar Ghalley||3,534||23.46|| |- |align=left|Tshewang Lhamo||2,458||16.31|| |- |align=left|Kinlay Dorji||1,725||11.45|| |- |align=left|Pema Tenzin||1,586||10.53||align=left|Unseated |- |align=left|Damcho Gyeltshen||684||4.54|| |- |align=left rowspan=10|Dagana||align=left|Surjaman Thapa||2,636||18.89||align=left|Elected |- |align=left|Birendra Chimoria||2,394||17.15|| |- |align=left|Dawa Rigyel||1,975||14.15|| |- |align=left|Kinzang Gyaltshen||1,115||7.99|| |- |align=left|Tenzin Samdrup||1,107||7.93|| |- |align=left|Suraj Pradhan||1,091||7.82|| |- |align=left|San Man Gurung||1,060||7.59|| |- |align=left|Birkha Bdr.
